programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll examine some of the animal kingdom's fastest sprinters, like the Cheetah. Also, the mysteries of animal intelligence are revealed as we take a look at Dolphins and Orangutans.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine some of the world's most fearsome predators. Find out why Owls are the only birds that can fly without making any sound. And how the Leopard uses its amazing night vision to catch its prey.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: The week from oceans to mountains we follow the paths of animal migrations. We start in Hawaii as Philippe joins a humpback whale research team to get up close and in the water with these majestic animals that swim thousands of miles each year to and from Alaska. Then it's into the rocky mountains to see how Jackson, Wyoming accommodates thousands of elk that migrate to this area each winter.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: See how we can save our planet. We start at the Karen Beasley Sea Turtle Rescue and Rehabilitation center in North Carolina as Philippe gets a tour of this incredible facility. We then head to the beach where dozens of sea turtles are released back into the wild. In the Pacific Ocean, Trilogy Excursions leads regular coral reef cleaning to preserve the ecosystems there.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 30 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Adam Lamberti is BACK! He and the boys debate the 2026 #1 pick. Will it be Spanos or will is be Spallina? Adam gives us some more players to look out for heading into next years college season. The boys talk LEGACY, debating which top PLL player and coach needs a championship the most to boost their legacy. Now that Doogs' who should the mvp should've been rankings have come to an end, Kev puts his spin on it. Top 5 VILLAIN rankings. All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

Now that Doogs' who should the mvp should've been rankings have come to an end, Kev puts his spin on it. Top 5 VILLAIN rankings. All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Mikita Badziakouski holds the chip lead ahead of Ali Imsirovic, Daniel Negreanu, Jason Koon, and Seth Davies in Event 10. There is $342,000 awaiting the eventual winner, while Negreanu is eyeing the Poker Masters Purple Jacket.

programme.title: Torn

programme.title: The Love We Had
programme.desc: After one decision destroys the life of a young couple, it continues to ruin their other relationships and everything they hold sacred.

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.desc: A former felon looking for redemption tries to steer inner-city kids away from crime by forming an unconventional chess club in Washington, DC.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Grizzly

programme.title: Creepshow III

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
programme.desc: The evil alien known as the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm) has infiltrated the minds of Mike (A. Michael Baldwin) and Reggie (Reggie Bannister). The two friends embark on a journey to find and kill him, only to discover that he has destroyed town after town, leaving zombies in place of the living. Along the way, Mike and Reggie meet several characters who share their goal, including a murderous boy named Tim (Kevin Connors) and two young women who are excellent fighters.

programme.title: Phantasm IV: Oblivion
programme.desc: Mike escapes the Tall Man, who’d begun to transform him, leaving Reggie to hop dimensions until he finds the truth about the night his brother died.

programme.title: Phantasm: Ravager
programme.desc: The phantasm nightmare comes to an end as reality blurs for a hero in search of his friend and out to vanquish a villain who can be two places at once

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. He also plants out tender annuals in the jewel garden, and with hot, dry summer days ahead, shares tips for water saving and harvesting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The show comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Arit Anderson, Toby Buckland and Adam Frost reveal the latest in floral fashions and share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Coming from the biggest horticultural event in the North, the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries in the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her very first garden for a summer catch-up and an update on her progress since moving in. Meanwhile, Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to take cuttings from herbs, prune summer raspberries and plant daylilies. Meanwhile, Adam travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet and windy weather.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants bulbs in pots, including hyacinths and daffodils. He shares tips and advice on what to do when apples and pears have been affected by diseases such as canker and brown rot. Plus, he gives a timely guide on how to collect and save seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the arrival of summer by making a start on his new scented border, and offers a few suggestions for what to be getting on with this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the borders at Longmeadow hit their stride, it's time to take stock of what's looking good and what needs replacing. Monty shares his tips on how to keep the display going all summer long. There's plenty to do on the vegetable plot too and things are looking promising in the fruit garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty considers a revamp of his cottage garden, divides perennials to get new plants for free and plants bulbs in pots for spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Presenting from York Gate in Leeds, Adam Frost, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill celebrate a garden for all seasons and tackle a bunch of seasonal jobs for September.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Surround yourself with this gorgeous Bob Ross painting; there's plenty of thick, velvety green grass, trees and foliage to just lose yourself in!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a gentle brook flowing from one oval to another, under the protective branches and foliage of stately birch trees.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Enjoy this fascinating experience of watching Bob Ross bring these deep dark woods alive; incredible magic on a partial black canvas.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Drink in the astonishing beauty of a spectacular desert as you ride down a well traveled road with the amazing brushes of Bob Ross.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A gentle bubbling stream in the midst of the forest - Bob Ross invites you to share the serenity of Nature's escape with this delightful painting.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel with Bob Ross into an evening display of glowing, magnificent setting sun. Another unique oval painting you'll have to see.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | On the Track with Some Serious Race Cars
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole is on the race track with the legendary Ferrari 458 GTE and the new Maserati MC20 GT2

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Datsun, imported Ferrari, Swedish classics and a 289 Cobra name "Dirtbag"
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us a vast array of interesting barn finds from a low-mileage Datsun 510 to a imported Ferrari 400i. After finding a few Swedish classics in Michigan, Tom gets the story of how a 289 Cobra got the nickname, "Dirtbag."

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The NEW Ferrari Purosangue and Roma Spider
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives Ferrari's new V12-powered SUV in the mountains of northern Italy to try to decipher exactly what the Purosangue is all about.Next, Henry reviews the new Ferrari Roma Spider.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rare Lotus Eleven, a 327 Corvette Stingray, a Chevy C10 with 148 original miles
programme.desc: This episode features a rare Lotus Eleven once owned by Colin Chapman, a 327 Chevy Corvette Stingray with a 4-speed, and a Chevrolet C10 pickup truck with only 148 miles on the odometer.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mercedes Gullwing found in storage unit!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us to a storage unit in an undisclosed location where an amazing prototype Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing sits in completely unrestored condition. Tom then finds himself in California with some old Fords and Mercurys.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Chevy-powered Jaguar E-Type and a Ford Bronco Driveway Find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets the details on a Jaguar E-Type with Chevy V-8 powertrain. Next, he heads south to discover a long-owned Ford Bronco that's been sitting in a man's driveway for quite some time.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Two rare JDM legends
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of two JDM legends: the Honda NSX-R and Nissan NISMO 400R

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Tokyo Drift Reborn; Totem Automobili
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Tokyo to check out the vibrant car scene that has gone from underground to mainstream. Next, Larry heads to Italy where he meets Riccardo Quaggio, the CEO of Alfa Romeo restomod builder, Totem Automobili.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The Lancia Delta S4 Stradale and a Lotus Elise restomod
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives one his dream cars, the Lancia Delta S4 Stradale.Next, Henry jumps in a Lotus Elise restomod that features some unique touches inspired by the legendary McLaren F1 supercar.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Mazda MX-5 and Alpine A110 R Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the latest Mazda MX-5 and the new Alpine A110 R.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Skyline GT-R and Flame-spewing Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah drives two imported modified Nissan Skyline GT-Rs to discover what makes the Skyline the perfect tuner car for whatever your goal.After that, Matt takes you on a wild ride in some insane flame-throwing hot rods.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | R-Code Ford, De Tomaso Pantera, and Ford Hot Rods
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds an R-Code Ford Galaxie 500, a De Tomaso Pantera and a more. Next, he heads to Alaska and discovers a stash of Ford hot rods.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - AMC Pacer and "The Foosenberg"
programme.desc: Chip Foose reimagines the much maligned but legendary AMC Pacer as a custom delivery van.In part two of this program is a ""doozy!"" Chip explores the design of the legendary Deusenberg.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, Porsche Boxster
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drive a Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, and a 2002 Porsche Boxster. Follow along as Magnus discovers whether or not these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchple | New Shelby Cobra, Original Mazda RX-7 FD
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the BRAND NEW Shelby Cobra. Does it live up to the legend? Next, Henry does a retro review on a completely original Mazda RX-7 FD.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mopars drag racing in the streets, plus a tour of Tom's barn finds
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some interesting barn finds in Northern Michigans, one of which leads to an impromptu drag race. Next, Tom gives us a tour of the barn find cars he's collected over the years.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - VW Beetle, Classic Mini, and a USPS Mail Truck
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose uses his incredible drawing and design abilities to rethink and re-imagine the looks of the Volkswagen Beetle, classic Austin Mini Cooper, and... a USPS mail truck?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories of the Mk8 VW GTI and Corrado
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explains why he thinks the Volkswagen Mk7 GTI is a better overall car than the new Mk8.Next, Jason explore the gorgeous styling and impressive performance of the Volkswagen Corrado.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Corvettes vs. The World
programme.desc: We drag race the first-ever hybrid, all-wheel-drive Corvette E-Ray against two Italian Supercars: the Ferrari F8 and Lamborghini Huracan Evo RWD.After that, it's the 2023 C8 Corvette Z06 against a Porsche 992 GT3, a Ducati V4 SP2, and an Audi R8.

programme.title: The Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Gullwing Mercedes and the Maserati MC12
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives the Mercedes-Benz W194, also known as the 300 SL. Next, he gets behind the wheel of the Maserati MC12.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Bentley Continental GT and Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Bentley Continental GT and the Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. To wrap things up, Colin appraises a well-documented 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28 "DZ-code."

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | 1100 HP Camaro and Corvette, Nissan's Secret to Success
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Jun Hardcore to check out Rocket Bunny Racing's unique, high-horsepower classic Corvette and Camaro builds. Next, Larry discusses Nissans iconic car designs with "The KYZA" and Cody Walker, brother of Paul Walker.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: MODIFIED - A Safari Audi RS 4 and a Restomod Willys Jeep EV
programme.desc: Matt Farah gets behind the wheel of a JDM B5 Audi RS 4 that's received a Safari conversion courtesy of custom shop AI Design.Next, Matt jumps behind the wheel of a heavily modified WWII-era Willys Jeep.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Modified Jaguar MK II, a rare Fiat Abarth, and a Toyota FJ40
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a modified Jaguar Mark II and determines if the modifications were worth the investment. Next, Colin gives us the inside scoop on a car 2-cylinder Fiat Abarth and a Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Bugatti EB110 and Volkswagen XL1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the Quad-Turbo, V-12 Bugatti EB110. Next, he dives into a car most people don't know exists: the Volkswagen XL1, a car capable of 250 miles per gallon.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Porsche Stories: The new 911 GT3 and wild history of the 924
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa argues why the Porsche GT3 is now, unquestionably, the most important car in the 911 lineup.Next, Jason explores the wild history of the Porsche 924 and why it was never meant to be a Porsche.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen | Daigo Saito and TJ Hunt
programme.desc: Larry Chen visits of of the greatest drift car garages in the world owned my driver Daigo Saito. After that, Larry visits TJ Hunt and gets the details on his GT-R-powered Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Pontiac Fiero and Ford Taurus SHO
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa, we learn about the infamous Pontiac Fiero and the fastest, most expensive sedan Ford ever made... the Taurus SHO.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mustang and a rare Mercury
programme.desc: Tom Cotter come across a prototype 1963 Ford Mustang that was specifically built for Henry Ford II. Next, Tom finds a gentleman with a driveway and garage packed full of oddball cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Pizzas and Sports Cars, and IROC Lives Again!
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen who's pizza business allowed him to collect a stockpile of European sports cars. Next, Tom meets up with Ray Evernham at the re-launch of the IROC race series.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Jaguar E-Type, 1927 Chrysler, and a GTO parked for 40 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter comes across an all-original 1967 Jaguar E-Type and wide variety of MGs, along with a 1927 Chrysler 60 that's original down to the door knobs and electrical. Next up, a Pontiac GTO that has been parked for over 40 years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Oldsmobiles, Mopars, Pontiacs and Fords!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds Oldsmobile barn find heaven (with some Mopars and Pontiacs sprinkled in for good measure). After that, Tom stumbles upon a 1970 Shelby Mustang GT500 buried in a garage, but in amazing condition.

programme.title: MODIFIED - The Legendary RUF CTR Yellowbird and a 911-beating Cayman
programme.desc: Bruce Meyer lent Matt Farah this first-built RUF CTR Yellowbird, a car built by one of the most legendary European tuners.Next, Matt jumps in a heavily modified Porsche Cayman and discovers the potential it has for being BETTER than a 911.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole - The Rocketeer MX-V6 and new Renault 5 E-Tech
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the incredible Rocketeer MX-V6, a naturally aspirated, V-6 powered Mazda MX-5 Miata restomod. Next, Henry jumps in the new Renault 5 E-Tech: an affordable, fun EV for the masses?

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Ultimate 90's JDM cars and McLaren drift car
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Emelia Hartford to cruise around in some amazing 1990's JDM classics. Next, Larry meets up with Andy Gray and his WILD McLaren MP4-12C GT3 drift car.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Massive stash of cars in old car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a tour of an enormous "museum" of forgotten cars stashed in a defunct car dealership. Tom's next stop reveals a rare Corvair, a large collection of Mazdas, and a rare "Alfa Jr."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Subaru BRZ and Alfa Romeo SZ
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us why the new Subaru BRZ does NOT, in fact, need a turbo by comparing it to the Mazda MX-5 ND2 Miata. Next, Jason dives into the story behind one of the ugliest cars ever, the Alfa Romeo SZ

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Inherited barn find collection and a wild fiberglass coupe
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets two brothers who just inherited a lifetime collection of eclectic cars. After that, Tom finds an extremely unique fiberglass coupe that once ran on "half of a Deusenberg" engine.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Hertz 1966 GT350, and a 700HP Shelby GT500
programme.desc: Shelby expert Colin Comer appraises a 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz car with a period-correct Paxton Supercharger. And if that's not enough Carroll Shelby for you, Colin checks out a 700HP 1967 Shelby GT500 with TWO Paxton superchargers!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Impala, Eagle, Galaxie, Pinto and MORE!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter checks out a 1964 Impala SS, a lifted AMC Eagle 4x4, a 1963 Ford Galaxie 500 Convertible, and some Ford Pinto race cars with SCCA and IMSA race history.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Chris Jacobs' Porsche 911 Targa, a Purple Porsche 930, and a ZL1 Camaro clone
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs stops by to surprise Colin with his ""Daily"" 1985 Porsche 911 Targa and throws Colin for a loop.After that, Colin takes a look at a Porsche 930 Turbo tuned to ""outrun the cops,"" and a ZL1 clone Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | On the Track with Some Serious Race Cars
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole is on the race track with the legendary Ferrari 458 GTE and the new Maserati MC20 GT2

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Datsun, imported Ferrari, Swedish classics and a 289 Cobra name "Dirtbag"
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us a vast array of interesting barn finds from a low-mileage Datsun 510 to a imported Ferrari 400i. After finding a few Swedish classics in Michigan, Tom gets the story of how a 289 Cobra got the nickname, "Dirtbag."

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The NEW Ferrari Purosangue and Roma Spider
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives Ferrari's new V12-powered SUV in the mountains of northern Italy to try to decipher exactly what the Purosangue is all about.Next, Henry reviews the new Ferrari Roma Spider.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rare Lotus Eleven, a 327 Corvette Stingray, a Chevy C10 with 148 original miles
programme.desc: This episode features a rare Lotus Eleven once owned by Colin Chapman, a 327 Chevy Corvette Stingray with a 4-speed, and a Chevrolet C10 pickup truck with only 148 miles on the odometer.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mercedes Gullwing found in storage unit!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us to a storage unit in an undisclosed location where an amazing prototype Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing sits in completely unrestored condition. Tom then finds himself in California with some old Fords and Mercurys.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Chevy-powered Jaguar E-Type and a Ford Bronco Driveway Find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets the details on a Jaguar E-Type with Chevy V-8 powertrain. Next, he heads south to discover a long-owned Ford Bronco that's been sitting in a man's driveway for quite some time.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Two rare JDM legends
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of two JDM legends: the Honda NSX-R and Nissan NISMO 400R

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Tokyo Drift Reborn; Totem Automobili
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Tokyo to check out the vibrant car scene that has gone from underground to mainstream. Next, Larry heads to Italy where he meets Riccardo Quaggio, the CEO of Alfa Romeo restomod builder, Totem Automobili.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The Lancia Delta S4 Stradale and a Lotus Elise restomod
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives one his dream cars, the Lancia Delta S4 Stradale.Next, Henry jumps in a Lotus Elise restomod that features some unique touches inspired by the legendary McLaren F1 supercar.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Mazda MX-5 and Alpine A110 R Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the latest Mazda MX-5 and the new Alpine A110 R.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Skyline GT-R and Flame-spewing Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah drives two imported modified Nissan Skyline GT-Rs to discover what makes the Skyline the perfect tuner car for whatever your goal.After that, Matt takes you on a wild ride in some insane flame-throwing hot rods.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | R-Code Ford, De Tomaso Pantera, and Ford Hot Rods
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds an R-Code Ford Galaxie 500, a De Tomaso Pantera and a more. Next, he heads to Alaska and discovers a stash of Ford hot rods.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - AMC Pacer and "The Foosenberg"
programme.desc: Chip Foose reimagines the much maligned but legendary AMC Pacer as a custom delivery van.In part two of this program is a ""doozy!"" Chip explores the design of the legendary Deusenberg.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, Porsche Boxster
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drive a Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, and a 2002 Porsche Boxster. Follow along as Magnus discovers whether or not these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchple | New Shelby Cobra, Original Mazda RX-7 FD
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the BRAND NEW Shelby Cobra. Does it live up to the legend? Next, Henry does a retro review on a completely original Mazda RX-7 FD.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mopars drag racing in the streets, plus a tour of Tom's barn finds
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some interesting barn finds in Northern Michigans, one of which leads to an impromptu drag race. Next, Tom gives us a tour of the barn find cars he's collected over the years.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - VW Beetle, Classic Mini, and a USPS Mail Truck
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose uses his incredible drawing and design abilities to rethink and re-imagine the looks of the Volkswagen Beetle, classic Austin Mini Cooper, and... a USPS mail truck?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories of the Mk8 VW GTI and Corrado
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explains why he thinks the Volkswagen Mk7 GTI is a better overall car than the new Mk8.Next, Jason explore the gorgeous styling and impressive performance of the Volkswagen Corrado.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Corvettes vs. The World
programme.desc: We drag race the first-ever hybrid, all-wheel-drive Corvette E-Ray against two Italian Supercars: the Ferrari F8 and Lamborghini Huracan Evo RWD.After that, it's the 2023 C8 Corvette Z06 against a Porsche 992 GT3, a Ducati V4 SP2, and an Audi R8.

programme.title: The Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Gullwing Mercedes and the Maserati MC12
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives the Mercedes-Benz W194, also known as the 300 SL. Next, he gets behind the wheel of the Maserati MC12.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Bentley Continental GT and Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Bentley Continental GT and the Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. To wrap things up, Colin appraises a well-documented 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28 "DZ-code."

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | 1100 HP Camaro and Corvette, Nissan's Secret to Success
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Jun Hardcore to check out Rocket Bunny Racing's unique, high-horsepower classic Corvette and Camaro builds. Next, Larry discusses Nissans iconic car designs with "The KYZA" and Cody Walker, brother of Paul Walker.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: MODIFIED - A Safari Audi RS 4 and a Restomod Willys Jeep EV
programme.desc: Matt Farah gets behind the wheel of a JDM B5 Audi RS 4 that's received a Safari conversion courtesy of custom shop AI Design.Next, Matt jumps behind the wheel of a heavily modified WWII-era Willys Jeep.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Modified Jaguar MK II, a rare Fiat Abarth, and a Toyota FJ40
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a modified Jaguar Mark II and determines if the modifications were worth the investment. Next, Colin gives us the inside scoop on a car 2-cylinder Fiat Abarth and a Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Bugatti EB110 and Volkswagen XL1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the Quad-Turbo, V-12 Bugatti EB110. Next, he dives into a car most people don't know exists: the Volkswagen XL1, a car capable of 250 miles per gallon.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Porsche Stories: The new 911 GT3 and wild history of the 924
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa argues why the Porsche GT3 is now, unquestionably, the most important car in the 911 lineup.Next, Jason explores the wild history of the Porsche 924 and why it was never meant to be a Porsche.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen | Daigo Saito and TJ Hunt
programme.desc: Larry Chen visits of of the greatest drift car garages in the world owned my driver Daigo Saito. After that, Larry visits TJ Hunt and gets the details on his GT-R-powered Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Pontiac Fiero and Ford Taurus SHO
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa, we learn about the infamous Pontiac Fiero and the fastest, most expensive sedan Ford ever made... the Taurus SHO.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mustang and a rare Mercury
programme.desc: Tom Cotter come across a prototype 1963 Ford Mustang that was specifically built for Henry Ford II. Next, Tom finds a gentleman with a driveway and garage packed full of oddball cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Pizzas and Sports Cars, and IROC Lives Again!
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen who's pizza business allowed him to collect a stockpile of European sports cars. Next, Tom meets up with Ray Evernham at the re-launch of the IROC race series.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Jaguar E-Type, 1927 Chrysler, and a GTO parked for 40 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter comes across an all-original 1967 Jaguar E-Type and wide variety of MGs, along with a 1927 Chrysler 60 that's original down to the door knobs and electrical. Next up, a Pontiac GTO that has been parked for over 40 years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Oldsmobiles, Mopars, Pontiacs and Fords!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds Oldsmobile barn find heaven (with some Mopars and Pontiacs sprinkled in for good measure). After that, Tom stumbles upon a 1970 Shelby Mustang GT500 buried in a garage, but in amazing condition.

programme.desc: Bruce Meyer lent Matt Farah this first-built RUF CTR Yellowbird, a car built by one of the most legendary European tuners.Next, Matt jumps in a heavily modified Porsche Cayman and discovers the potential it has for being BETTER than a 911.

programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Emelia Hartford to cruise around in some amazing 1990's JDM classics. Next, Larry meets up with Andy Gray and his WILD McLaren MP4-12C GT3 drift car.

programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a tour of an enormous "museum" of forgotten cars stashed in a defunct car dealership. Tom's next stop reveals a rare Corvair, a large collection of Mazdas, and a rare "Alfa Jr."

programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us why the new Subaru BRZ does NOT, in fact, need a turbo by comparing it to the Mazda MX-5 ND2 Miata. Next, Jason dives into the story behind one of the ugliest cars ever, the Alfa Romeo SZ

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Inherited barn find collection and a wild fiberglass coupe
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets two brothers who just inherited a lifetime collection of eclectic cars. After that, Tom finds an extremely unique fiberglass coupe that once ran on "half of a Deusenberg" engine.

programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.desc: Shelby expert Colin Comer appraises a 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz car with a period-correct Paxton Supercharger. And if that's not enough Carroll Shelby for you, Colin checks out a 700HP 1967 Shelby GT500 with TWO Paxton superchargers!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Impala, Eagle, Galaxie, Pinto and MORE!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter checks out a 1964 Impala SS, a lifted AMC Eagle 4x4, a 1963 Ford Galaxie 500 Convertible, and some Ford Pinto race cars with SCCA and IMSA race history.

programme.desc: Chris Jacobs stops by to surprise Colin with his ""Daily"" 1985 Porsche 911 Targa and throws Colin for a loop.After that, Colin takes a look at a Porsche 930 Turbo tuned to ""outrun the cops,"" and a ZL1 clone Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are still at the Dirty bird in Oklahoma, trying to get a few more tasks done before heading back to the Raven in Missouri. They also manage to get out and do a little velvet scouting with the Hawk spotting scope.

programme.title: Behind the Draw
