programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail
programme.desc: On this week's episode we're diving into a hot topic during this time of the year, Fall food plots. In a round table format, the guys answer what their favorite food plot blend is, why it works best for them, where the best locations to plant food plots are, when you should plant your food plots, and finally how to plant a fall food plot. Diving into a ton of different options from our great friends at @monsterbuck , our goal is to give you somewhere to start for fall plots to hunt over this coming 2025 season. If you have any questions, suggestions, or thoughts please drop a comment below and let's have a conversation. As always, thank you for taking the time to watch the video and we hope you enjoyed it!

programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the dirty bird in Oklahoma kicking off the second day of bow season. Randy is already tagged out on a dandy of an 8 point we showed you last season in the “Camp Buck episode”. Joe Umphries from Big Tine is in camp and he is trying to close the deal on a buck he had a close call with last season at the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.
Kris Seymour and family target a couple big Kansas whitetails!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Captain Blair returns to the everglades to do an inshore day but is challenged by the wind. Will he be able to find the size Snook he's looking for?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different — until he picked up a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting camp—each with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: "Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor patiently pursue big tarpon from the Everglades to the Middle Keys with fly rod in hand."

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Richard Black for an exciting adventure in Key Largo, catching a wide variety of fish species on the shallow reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a frenzy of exciting Bluefish near Marathon, FL.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a productive wreck with which they enjoy the exciting variety of fish that wrecks can provide.

programme.desc: Captain Mike Travels to Venice Louisiana to target redfish in the Mississippi River delta.

programme.desc: The Direction TV's Annual Military Appreciation Episode. Two good friends, Thomas & Terry McWilliams, help to make this event take place. This episode is dedicated to our service men and women.

programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s still opening week of bow season in Oklahoma and the crew has three tags left to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi got an invitation on a late season whitetail hunt in Oklahoma. He joins Tom Petry for a rifle hunt on a property he has no history with, but it did have some good deer and lots of wild horses.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and friend, Rob Shaw hunt whitetails with their bows with Phire Creek Outdoors. They both hope Phire Creek and Kansas live up to their reputations of big whitetail bucks.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail
programme.desc: On this week's episode we're diving into a hot topic during this time of the year, Fall food plots. In a round table format, the guys answer what their favorite food plot blend is, why it works best for them, where the best locations to plant food plots are, when you should plant your food plots, and finally how to plant a fall food plot. Diving into a ton of different options from our great friends at @monsterbuck , our goal is to give you somewhere to start for fall plots to hunt over this coming 2025 season. If you have any questions, suggestions, or thoughts please drop a comment below and let's have a conversation. As always, thank you for taking the time to watch the video and we hope you enjoyed it!

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Watch along as Jay learns to clean fish from ‪@reedthefishmonger‬. Watch the full video and learn to clean any fish.

programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. programme.title: Ship Shape TV

programme.title: Robin Hood

programme.title: Knowing
programme.desc: An M.I.T. professor deciphers a code found within a mysterious time capsule and tries to prevent the ultimate catastrophe of which it foretells.

programme.title: Winchester

programme.title: La La Land

programme.title: La La Land
programme.desc: The imaginative musical tale of an aspiring actress and jazz musician falling in love as they struggle to make their dreams come true.

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix

programme.title: My Giant

programme.title: Almost Heroes

programme.title: Corruptor, The

programme.title: Fame

programme.title: Moving

programme.title: Memoirs Of An Invisible Man

programme.title: The Mummy Lives

programme.title: Curly Sue

programme.title: Her Alibi

programme.title: Martian Child

programme.desc: A medieval pickpocket who escapes the noose becomes indebted to a shapeshifting knight and his star-crossed lover on a revenge quest to kill a bishop.

programme.title: Pleasantville

programme.title: Who's That Girl?
programme.desc: A woman sets off on a madcap quest to find the person guilty of the crime for which she served the time.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: The Jane Austen classic portrays two sisters, one pragmatic, the other overly emotional, who both fall in love with men who are promised to others.

programme.title: Random Hearts
programme.desc: After losing their loved ones in a plane crash, a cop and a congresswoman discover their spouses were having an affair with each other.

programme.title: Blue-Eyed Butcher
programme.desc: Based on the shocking true story about a beautiful young wife and mother accused of the brutal murder of her seemingly perfect husband.

programme.title: Quicksilver
programme.desc: Losing his shirt after a bad day on the market, a stock trader makes ends meet as a bicycle courier and uncovers sinister web of intrigue and murder.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Running With Scissors
programme.desc: A teenage boy is "adopted" by his mother's wacky therapist and must cope with an extended family of eccentrics.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: When her plane crashes into a Chicago bridge, ace reporter Gale Gayley is saved by a mysterious and unlikely hero in this heart-warming comedy.

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: The 6th Day
programme.desc: In the future, a corporation has begun illegally cloning humans. They mistakenly clone the wrong man, who is now the only one who could expose them.

programme.title: Robot and Frank
programme.desc: An aging, cantankerous ex-cat burglar finds his zest for life renewed when he trains his robotic caretaker to help him commit heists.

programme.title: Vice Versa
programme.desc: An ill-gotten mystical skull has a body-and-mind-switching effect on a high-powered department store exec and his neglected 11-year-old son.

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims he’s Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: A rich woman and a communist sailor are stranded on a deserted Mediterranean island where, after some fights, they unexpectedly fall for each other.

programme.title: Lone Star State of Mind
programme.desc: Pressed for time before leaving Texas with his girlfriend, a mechanic must deal with the repercussions of his simple cousin’s latest bungled crime.

programme.title: The Master of Disguise
programme.desc: A waiter at his father’s Italian restaurant possesses an inherited talent for mimicry and learns how to use it to take on multiple identities.

programme.title: Family Business
programme.desc: A Westinghouse scholar recruits his criminal grandpa and reformed criminal dad to steal plasma from a research lab and share in the $1 million reward.

programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc: Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man before it is too late.

programme.title: Air
programme.desc: In the near future, breathable air is nonexistent. Two engineers, tasked with guarding the last hope for mankind, struggle to preserve their sanity.

programme.title: Predestination
programme.desc: When a secret governmental time traveling agency attempts to stop future criminals from their transgressions, a new kind of chaos ensues.

programme.title: The 6th Day
programme.desc: In the future, a corporation has begun illegally cloning humans. They mistakenly clone the wrong man, who is now the only one who could expose them.

programme.title: The Other Boleyn Girl
programme.desc: Based on the best-selling novel, The Other Boleyn Girl is a captivating tale of intrigue, romance and betrayal about two sisters who rival for the bed and heart of King Henry VIII.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns he’s engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Howard Duff) wants peace in the valley, but a cattle baron (Victor Jory) and his brothers want war.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: The Kid From Broken Gun
programme.desc: After years on the East Coast, former boxer Jack Mahoney (Jack Mahoney) returns to New Mexico and finds himself framed for murder. Though the only evidence is circumstantial, in the face of vicious prosecutor Kiefer (Myron Healey), Mahoney's girlfriend -- defense lawyer Gail Kingston (Angela Stevens) -- fails to convince the jury of his innocence. Determined to clear Mahoney's name, postal worker Steve Reynolds (Charles Starrett) transforms himself into the masked rider known as the Durango Kid.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Desert Vigilante
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) bags Mexican-border silver smugglers for Uncle Sam.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Thomasine & Bushrod
programme.desc: In this beloved Blaxploitation flick set in 1911, a team of thieves steal from wealthy capitalists, to return their riches to deserving families.

programme.desc: When a professor is murdered, his boss, his teaching assistant and a student all come under suspicion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new Forensic Pathologist Kam Karimore are drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching as they seek to identify the villain.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill. When a local forest-ranger suffers a strange death the visiting UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets in their search for the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Music industry royalty, Del Bryant has a Blazer he wants to pay tribute to his Tennessee roots.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny continues his El Caminos love affair with a 1975 beauty.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's battle with nightmare Z28 continues as he puts it though endless fabrication to bring it back to life. While it's being revived, Danny takes a break.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny must do a full bumper-to-bumper restoration on a '66 Mustang convertible, but after stripping it down, he finds very little car between her bumpers; Danny must to decide between asking for more money or losing a bunch of his own.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop has its hands full with a custom psychedelic bike, and Danny's infamous friend.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny trusts Horny Mike to paint a Medieval mural on a '73 GMC Pick Up truck, and soon regrets his decision.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: On this hour-long episode Danny is hosting a huge car show and needs to restore a '73 boat-tail Riviera to be the main attraction.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A high end client has his heart set on a tricked out '68 Camaro, so Danny sets out to find one and give it the world class Counts Kustoms treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Count's Kustoms speeds to the rescue after Kevin's son encounters trouble on the race track. Danny stumbles upon an extremely rare 1979 Dodge Dreamer.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Counts Kustom's master painter Ryan decides to paint his own van, the entire crew buckles in for a bumpy ride.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets started on a project that he's been waiting a long time to tackle, a 1971 Chevy C10 Pick Up. He plans to flip it for a big profit.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team continue wrestling with a stock restoration Mustang mess, hoping for extra funds and a lot of patience from their client; Kevin spots a rare old Grand Prix and Danny visits a world class specialist, looking for ideas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has big retro plans for a 1972 Cutlass he hopes to flip, and is counting on his fab team to do her right.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny must give up his prized 1972 Monte Carlo for one of his biggest clients, and is counting on his team to get the job done in one week.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets sidetracked by a curious lady in a hot pink Beetle while trying to score a classic Ford Galaxie.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The Count's Kustoms crew revisits some of the most unique projects ever commissioned; a '72 Chevy Blazer turned into a tailgater's dream; a chopper customized for an amputee rider; a '69 Pontiac Firebird brought back from the dead.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny buys a '78 Lincoln with some serious fire damage, but it's only when he takes it apart does he learn how bad it is.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: "Engine Whisperer" Doc has a cool '67 Firebird he's been working on. While he's a mechanical maestro under the hood, his paint skills are lacking so he enlists Ryan.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny decides to host a huge car show at his club Vamp'd to drum up business, and get all the local gearheads together to show off their newest toys.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A returning customer needs Danny's help restoring a 1971 Road Runner to give as a commemorative gift to his wife and step-daughter.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is visited by legendary Mistress of the Dark, Elvira, whose famous Thunderbird is in need of some mechanical magic.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team are commissioned to build a bike for a true American hero, a military veteran.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny decides to feature the 12 favorite cars in his collection in an official Count's Kustoms calendar.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and the team come together to make something special for Danny. Meanwhile Danny runs into an old pal and his 1959 Corvette gasser.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the boys meet with a customer who wants a wicked paint job to match his wicked 1959 Anglia dragster.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After two blown sales, Danny finally gets to customize a 1960 Chevy Delivery the way he wants to.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Mike buys a Smart car and wants to trick it out at the shop, but Kevin warns that Danny hates new cars and can't find out about it until it's done.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Chumlee from Gold & Silver stops by to pick up his custom 1963 Lincoln, but gets some really bad news instead.

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a jetpack from the Gemini space program; a Snoopy comic book with a personal drawing from Charles Schulz; Rick's take on a commercial for the pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A pair of rifles with double rotating barrels; Corey and Chumlee check out a pair of cleats worn by Yankees legend Bucky Dent; Chumlee breaks the coffee machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tries to refurbish a 1950's coke machine into a modernized collector's item. Will his plan quench his thirst or fizzle out and go flat? Meanwhile, Corey is offered an old pirate favorite: an 18th Century flintlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 1830s musket made by Eli Whitney shoots into the shop; a man brings in a golf ball once owned by President Lyndon B. Johnson; a man comes into the shop with a 1929 Chicago Cubs World Series press pin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Roar down the road with the Pawn Stars as they stumble upon a Down and Dirty custom motorcycle frame.

programme.desc: The guys give Chumlee a customized Harley-Davidson FXR for his 30th birthday; Rick and the Old Man look at a collection of original blueprints from the U.S.S. Maine; a wooden 1940s airplane propeller.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team travels to Utah for a rare shot at a 19th century Hotchkiss Revolving Cannon; an antique Wurlitzer jukebox grooves its way into the shop; a woman comes in hoping to sell her antique medical quackery device.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop heats up after Corey spends big bucks buying a huge 12 passenger hot air balloon--and at the same time breaking one of Rick's golden rules.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars are presented with the opportunity to add one of the world's most recognizable trophies to their collection--a Grammy. Will the gang put up the cash to get the gold or will the deal hit a sour note and be taken off the charts?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy a saddle that may have been used by Kevin Costner in Dances with Wolves. Will the gang pony-up and make the deal or will they let it ride off into the sunset?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a jetpack from the Gemini space program; a Snoopy comic book with a personal drawing from Charles Schulz; Rick's take on a commercial for the pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A pair of rifles with double rotating barrels; Corey and Chumlee check out a pair of cleats worn by Yankees legend Bucky Dent; Chumlee breaks the coffee machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tries to refurbish a 1950's coke machine into a modernized collector's item. Will his plan quench his thirst or fizzle out and go flat? Meanwhile, Corey is offered an old pirate favorite: an 18th Century flintlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 1830s musket made by Eli Whitney shoots into the shop; a man brings in a golf ball once owned by President Lyndon B. Johnson; a man comes into the shop with a 1929 Chicago Cubs World Series press pin.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from--Godwin's House.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The race is on to make it to Prudhoe before a wicked storm turns fierce.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With just three weeks to go, everyone is pushing it to the limit to get the freight to Deadhorse before the season ends. Lisa rushes to Carlile to pick up her next load.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With only days remaining in the season to determine the load count winner, Polar and VP Express race to deliver hauls over the rapidly melting roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The Ice Road Truckers battle across the continent over frozen lakes, rivers, and ocean. Alex heads farther north than ever before on the deadly Dempster.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Hugh and Rick roll deeper into the Canadian outback, while a dangerous overflow may leave Alex stranded in the wilderness. Dave's training run with Tony reaches the boiling point.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The brutal Alaskan winter hits Prudhoe Bay with a vengeance, unleashing a ruthless windstorm.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The pressure on the drivers builds as the temperatures plunge to 55 below; Jack gets into it with a southbound driver; Hugh gets an earful from an American driver; Alex picks up a hitchhiker; Ray takes on Atigun Pass.

programme.desc: With the sun beating down on the ice, the road is melting at an accelerating rate.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Battle lines are drawn in Manitoba. Hugh Rowland returns to the winter roads with a grudge and a goal: run his previous employer out of town.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's half way through the grueling ice road season. Six hundred truckers have ferried more than 4,000 loads to the northern mines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Truckers have hauled more than 100,000 tons of supplies in temperatures of forty degrees below zero, but accidents and strict safety regulations have sent many drivers packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Lisa tackles the most dangerous haul of the season, trucking a multi-million dollar, 100 ton load across the entire state of Alaska.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the end of the season nears, Polar tries to fulfill their contract over the unregulated road to Utik Lake. But when a jackknifed truck blocks the remote trail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After releasing the second part of his autobiography, Dog and his family traveled across America, and this very special episode offers an intimate portrait of both the public and private moments of that journey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What do you do when you have a fugitive you not only want to find, but believe can be helped back onto the straight and narrow? If you're Mary Ellen you call you good friend Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team. But they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Fugitive beware: Dog's rolling with extra power today. His old friends Tim Chapman and Sonny Westbrook are riding with the team, so their target, a thief with violent tendencies, is out of luck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For months, this fugitive has been stringing Leland along with a series of barely believable excuses. Out of patience, Leland calls in the Big Dog. The team whole team heads out to put pressure on the family and friends of this imposing 300-pound felon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the co-signer of a bond is also romantically involved with the defendant, sometimes the bondman is put in the middle of a lover's quarrel. But sometimes the defendant is a threat to the community and the cosigner asks the bondsman for protection.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Denver helping Bobby Brown to track down a fugitive with a long rap sheet. But unfortunately they have no picture of the felon to work with, so the challenges are big on this one.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After releasing the second part of his autobiography, Dog and his family traveled across America, and this very special episode offers an intimate portrait of both the public and private moments of that journey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What do you do when you have a fugitive you not only want to find, but believe can be helped back onto the straight and narrow? If you're Mary Ellen you call you good friend Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team. But they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes that the family that plays together stays together. But what happens when a family's idea of fun is getting high and running amuck? Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Dog decides to spend the day caring for his newest granddaughter, Beth enlists the girls to hunt down a female fugitive. Heading into a dangerous part of town the ladies will use their feminine wiles to track this mother gone wrong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive he always promises them that it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kolani's on the run, left his wife to look after four kids and left Dog holding the bag for the $10k bond. Apparently the lure of the streets and other women have drawn him away from his commitments.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon Tim jumps into action.

programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.desc: Dog answers two very different calls for help from women. In the first case, he helps Leland protect Maria, who's being threatened by her violent husband.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog thinks he's got an average day of bounty hunting ahead of him, but he couldn't be more wrong. Beth calls a client, Daphne, whose bond they have to revoke and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows very little about Peter, but what he does know, he doesn't like! Not only is he currently facing two counts of second degree sexual assault, he's racked up numerous restraining orders over the years.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits--Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers--the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the local cops put out an APB for a client with a checked past, Dog springs into action. With the aid of the runner's girlfriend the posse heads out to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team really have their hands full when they go after a tough guy named Nunu, who leads them on a chase through apartment complexes and a shopping mall before he's finally captured. But Dog is charmed by Nunu's unquenchable

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team must deal with misleading informants, belligerent boaters, and angry drunks when they go after Kimberly, a traffic offender with over 20 violations. And if that isn't enough, Dog has another problem -- Duane Lee is sick.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the team hunts for Steven, a fugitive with a history of domestic abuse, they seek help from his girlfriend, who's been a victim of his abuse. Meanwhile, Beth trains for a 5K race to help raise awareness about domestic abuse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been raining for days and the team is going a little stir crazy. Dog however has the cure--a good hunt. Maui has failed to appear on a drug charge and the team has just one lead.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to help two of his bondsmen buddies, Dave "Red" Widhelm and "Downtown" Bobby Brown. First up is Red, who has a client named Alvin who failed to appear on a $20,000 bond with charges of drug possession and distribution pending.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Chevie and Cheyne Kehoe gained national attention after a videotaped shoot-out with state and local officers in Wilmington, Ohio on February 15, 1997. The officers were unharmed, but the brothers escaped and fled the state. The FBI tracked the two armed men, learning that Chevie and an associate, Daniel Lee, were suspects in a 1996 triple murder in Arkansas.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the winter of 2001, two well-loved and respected college professors are found murdered in their home. Nothing about the case makes sense. No items are missing from the home and the couple had no known enemies. Local police and FBI agents form a task force to find a pair of homegrown killers and a motive for the brutal crime they committed.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Racial tensions in Buffalo in 1980 were at an all-time high. Six black males had been brutally murdered--two had their hearts cut out. The only thing connecting the victims was their ethnicity and the fact that each had been shot with .22 caliber bullets. Residents screamed for the police to stop this serial killer. With no suspects, local investigators turned to the FBI. Profilers were able to produce a psychological composite of the type of person the killer would most likely be. Their analysis paid off.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He wandered the streets of New York City wearing only pajamas and a bathrobe, but the FBI was convinced that Vince Gigante, the reputed boss of the Genovese crime family, was anything but crazy. The FBI used undercover surveillance, secret audio tapes, six mobsters turned government informants and the testimony of twelve FBI agents to help convict Gigante of murder and conspiracy-to-murder, including a plot to kill rival mob boss John Gotti.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The story of the most celebrated warrior king in history still stirs fascination more than 2,000 years after his death. But the location of his body is the subject of much debate. When his remains suddenly disappear without a trace, a search across the ancient world ensues. What happened to the mummy of Alexander the Great?

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The Titanic's tragic story captures the imagination of the public and experts of all kinds, who, decades after the ship's demise, still seek answers; a look into new evidence that might reveal more about how and why the Titanic sank.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The death of one of history's most enigmatic rulers, Egypt's King Tutankhamun remains shrouded in mystery 3300 years later. Scientific advancements may be getting us closer to the identity of King Tut's killer.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In Ireland, the notion of the fairy folk dates back thousands of years and originates with stories of powerful shining beings who came down from the sky; exploring if these tales have been inspired by ancient alien visitation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The team investigates the world's oldest and most incredible relics up close; Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most mysterious artifacts from all over the globe, those he believes provide undeniable proof of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Mutual UFO Network is an organization devoted to the scientific investigation of unidentified aerial phenomena and other unexplained encounters; with more than five decades of investigations, MUFON's extensive database could contain proof.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the nearly 2,000-year-old text called "The Zohar," there is a curious passage that describes hidden realms beneath the surface of the Earth, each of which is said to be populated by both human and non-human intelligences.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The possibility of direct human contact with extraterrestrial life within the highest levels of the U.S. government.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the world's top 10 mysterious devices, from strange, grooved disks found in a cave in China to an ancient Greek computer to an incredible crystal skull unearthed in Mexico.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Terrifying encounters at 40,000 feet; pilot accounts of UFOs taking control of their aircraft; entire jumbo jets disappearing into thin air; since the dawn of aviation, pilots have experienced unexplainable events in the sky.
